meanings.definition: To enslave or make someone a slave.
meanings.sent1: The evil sorcerer beslaved the villagers with his dark magic.
meanings.sent2: The cruel dictator beslaved the entire population, forcing them to work without pay.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous fairy beslaved the misbehaving children, making them clean up their mess.
meanings.sent4: The addiction beslaved him, chaining him to his destructive habits.
meanings.sent5: The chains of debt beslaved her, trapping her in a cycle of borrowing and repayment.

meanings.definition: To be under the control or domination of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The kingdom was beslaved by the tyrant, who ruled with an iron fist.
meanings.sent2: She felt beslaved by her own fears, unable to break free from their grip.
meanings.sent3: The cat beslaved the household, demanding attention and treats at all hours.
meanings.sent4: His mind was beslaved by doubt, clouding his judgment and decision-making.
meanings.sent5: The forest was beslaved by darkness, hiding its secrets in shadows and mystery.
